problem.p: Considering specifically when the arrival rate is less than 2 per minute (λ < 2):

multiplechoiceresponse.label: The system can be approximated as what type of Queue?

formularesponse.label: Write an expression with \(\lambda\), representing the average Queue length:
formularesponse.description: To represent \(\lambda\), use "lambda" in your expression below.

p.span: Note that the arrival rate exceeds the service rate during some intervals. This is not a problem since the lengths of the intervals are finite. The queue length grows during such periods. The service rate is always 2 per minute. During the periods when the arrival rate is less than 2, we can approximate the system as an M/M/1 queue in steady state. The average queue length is then λ/(2 − λ).
